articles.headline: A Fighter Jet’s Fate Poses a Quandary for Obama
articles.snippet: Two of Barack Obama’s goals — creating jobs and cutting waste — may collide in a decision over the F-22 fighter.
articles.abstract: Two of Barack Obama’s goals — creating jobs and cutting waste — may collide in a decision over the F-22 fighter.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two of President-elect Barack Obama’s stated goals  cutting wasteful spending and saving or creating millions of jobs  are on a collision course in a looming decision over whether to keep building the F-22 fighter jet.

articles.headline: For Biotech, a Tax Break Spells Hope
articles.snippet: In its pitch to Congress, the biotech industry will portray itself as a model of innovation.
articles.abstract: In its pitch to Congress, the biotech industry will portray itself as a model of innovation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Move over Big Three. Little Biotech is joining you in seeking federal assistance.

articles.headline: Dire Forecast for Global Economy and Trade
articles.snippet: The world economy is on the brink of a rare global recession, the World Bank said, with world trade projected to fall for the first time since 1982.
articles.abstract: The world economy is on the brink of a rare global recession, the World Bank said, with world trade projected to fall for the first time since 1982.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The world economy is on the brink of a rare global recession, the World Bank said in a forecast released Tuesday, with world trade projected to fall next year for the first time since 1982 and capital flows to developing countries predicted to plunge 50 percent.

articles.headline: $73 an Hour: Adding It Up
articles.snippet: The gap between the pay of Big Three autoworkers and workers at foreign-owned plants is less than it seems.
articles.abstract: The gap between the pay of Big Three autoworkers and workers at foreign-owned plants is less than it seems.

articles.headline: Governor Accused in Scheme to Sell Obama’s Senate Seat
articles.snippet: The case extended beyond the Senate appointment and left many wondering who else might yet be implicated in Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich’s negotiations.
articles.abstract: The case extended beyond the Senate appointment and left many wondering who else might yet be implicated in Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich’s negotiations.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  The governor of Illinois brazenly put up for sale his appointment of Barack Obama’s successor in the United States Senate, federal prosecutors said Tuesday.

articles.headline: From Canned Goods to Fresh, Food Banks Adapt
articles.snippet: Food banks are preparing ready-to-eat meals, opening their own farms and handling much more fresh produce.
articles.abstract: Food banks are preparing ready-to-eat meals, opening their own farms and handling much more fresh produce.
articles.lead_paragraph: MADISON, Wis.  Vanessa Rosales comes to the St. Vincent de Paul Food Pantry here rather than others for one reason: She can choose what food she brings home, rather than being handed a bag filled with random groceries.

articles.headline: Foreign Automakers Say Little in Aid Debate
articles.snippet: Nearly all the foreign companies that build vehicles in the U.S. have said little publicly concerning whether their American rivals should get billions of dollars in aid.
articles.abstract: Nearly all the foreign companies that build vehicles in the U.S. have said little publicly concerning whether their American rivals should get billions of dollars in aid.
articles.lead_paragraph: There has been no shortage of opinions throughout the debate over a federal bailout for Detroit’s struggling automakers. But one group has been notably silent: foreign car companies.

articles.headline: Portrait of a Politician: Vengeful and Profane
articles.snippet: Even the people of Illinois, familiar with political scandal, were not prepared for Tuesday’s bombshell.
articles.abstract: Even the people of Illinois, familiar with political scandal, were not prepared for Tuesday’s bombshell.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Little in Gov. Rod R. Blagojevich’s background prepared the people of Illinois for the man who was revealed in the criminal complaint that dropped like a bombshell here on Tuesday. Delusional, narcissistic, vengeful and profane, Mr. Blagojevich as portrayed by federal prosecutors shocked even his most ardent detractors.

articles.headline: As F.H.A.’s Role Grows, So Does the Risk of Fraud
articles.snippet: Its business is rising, but the federal mortgage guarantor is slow to weed out abusive lenders.
articles.abstract: Its business is rising, but the federal mortgage guarantor is slow to weed out abusive lenders.
articles.lead_paragraph: During the subprime boom, the Federal Housing Administration, created in 1934 to help lower-income and first-time buyers purchase homes, all but sat out the party.

articles.headline: Unexpected Drop in China’s Imports and Exports
articles.snippet: Global demand for Chinese products is vanishing as the financial crisis slows trade, one economist says.
articles.abstract: Global demand for Chinese products is vanishing as the financial crisis slows trade, one economist says.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING  Chinese exports registered their largest drop in nearly a decade last month, suggesting that the global recession could be far worse than many economists had previously predicted.
articles.byline: By Andrew Jacobs and David Barboza
